alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 9:41AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Geneva and Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, northern Jackson and northern Holmes Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, Miller, Dougherty, central Mitchell, Baker, Calhoun, Early, northern Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia and southern Worth Counties in south central Georgia through 1145 AM EDT/1045 AM CDT/... At 1041 AM EDT/941 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Morgan to 7 miles north of Colquitt to near Cottonwood to 7 miles southeast of Geneva. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Newton, Morgan, Albany, Blakely, Geneva, Putney, Graceville, Donalsonville, Sylvester, Camilla, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Edison and Arlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
